item.title: Secured SFTP setup
item.description: ObjectivesDeliver secured resources access to a Linux server through SFTP.SFTP accounts will only have access to allowed resource.An administrator account will be able to manage user accounts. Target User mode diagram Target Admin mode diagram ControlsSFTP activation in SSHD control[root@server /]# cat /etc/ssh/sshd_config .... # override default of no subsystems Subsystem sftp /usr/libexec/openssh/sftp-server Directory tree creationmkdir -p /directory chmod 700 /directory Example: [root@server /]# mkdir -p /data/sftp_group_1 [root@server /]# chmod 700 /data SFTP user and group creationgroupadd sftp_group_1 1 useradd -g sftp_group_1 -d / -s /sbin/nologin USER1 2 useradd -g sftp_group_1 -d / -s /sbin/nologin USER2 3 useradd -g sftp_group_1 -d / -s /sbin/nologin USER3 4 useradd -g sftp_group_1 -d / -s /sbin/nologin USER4 5User created group name ownership.
